Fields.DialogueText: *GWOMP*
This... is much heavier... than it looks...
Ursula? That's a lot of books you're carrying. And clothes too. What's going on?
Ah, Captain, perfect timing. Here, take some of these for me.
After our run-in with Mary it got me thinking. Suppose she had no family to return to that day. We certainly could not have brought her aboard such a dangerous ship. What would she have done?
I suppose *pant* you're right *wheeze*.
So many young orphans will never be able to reach their full potential without the loving support they deserve. Were I not under your command, Captain, I might very well have given up trying as well.
So what do you propose we do?
I want to start a charity. At first, I'll donate textbooks I no longer need to those not in education. Next, clothing we've picked up along our travels.

Fields.MenuText: How did you find clothing for children?

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't. I used the clothing around the ship and fashioned it into kids' sizes. My sewing skills are less than impressive, but it's enough to get the job done.

Fields.MenuText: What kind of textbooks are you donating?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing especially niche. Every child is different and will connect with different material, so I thought it best to just send along everything I had.

Fields.MenuText: Is the UK big on charity?

Fields.DialogueText: Very big, Captain. Organizations like Save the Children have been in full effect for several years now!
I see. In that case, tell me what I can do to help!
*ALARM*
First things first, Captain. It seems these Morganas are in need of some charitable donations as well.
I think we could spare a torpedo or two. Let's let them have it!
@BATTLE
Here you are, Captain. I got this for you.
A red spongy clown nose?
I'd like my charity to cater towards children. What's more amusing to a child than a bright red clown nose?
There aren't any kids here at present, though...
It's very amusing to ME if that's what you're concerned about, Captain. I may part with an extra book or two should you split my sides with a comedy routine.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have a future plan for this charity?

Fields.DialogueText: Obviously, I would like it to become a global commodity. However, I understand that may take some time. Rome wasn't built in a day.

Fields.MenuText: How much money, on average, is raised for these UK charities?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure of the exact sum, but some have been known to hit peaks of £10,000! If my charity can raise even half that amount I will be satisfied.

Fields.MenuText: Why are you only concerned about children?

Fields.DialogueText: Not "only", Captain; "especially!" Orphaned children or those without enough resources at their disposal are at far greater risk than grown adults.
So what kind of events did you have in mind for this charity?
I have a few ideas in mind. I'd very much appreciate your help.
You can rely on me, Ursula.
Then, without further ado, I welcome you to the fresh new charitable organization: "Multiple Offerings Raised, Given, And Naturally Accumulated". Or, for short--
*ALARM*
Morgana! I'll tell you more about the abbreviation later, Captain! For now, please lend me your assistance!
Uh... Ursula... I hate to tell you this, but...
No time, Captain! Please, we must proceed into battle at once!
@BATTLE
First on the agenda, I thought we could participate in a sponsored fun run.
We are docked for a while, I suppose...
I've collected sponsors from the crew based on the number of miles we run. Most have pledged between 50p and £1 per mile, so if we can hit ten miles that should be a hefty sum.
Ten miles!?
Good luck, Captain! I'll see you at the finish line!
*SOME TIME LATER*
Phew! What a workout. I hit ten miles, but the adrenaline kept me going until about fifteen! How are you feeling, Captain?
*WHEEEEZE* I'm doing... *PUFF* just dandy... *SPLUTTER* Perhaps we could expand our charity to those suffering from collapsed lungs...
This port reminds me of where we first ran into Mary. Luckily, she had parents to return to, but... I sometimes wonder what we would have done if she hadn't.

Fields.MenuText: Do you plan to adopt every orphan in the world?
What do you think Mary is doing right now?

Fields.DialogueText: I think she's causing a bother for her parents again. Just like all children should have the right to do!
If I can make a difference in one child's life, it will be enough for me to sleep easier at night.

Fields.MenuText: You sound like you'd make a great big sister.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd hope so. My sisters aren't particularly affectionate, but they always made sure I was unbothered.
Thank you for your help today, Captain. We've raised a lot of money that can be donated.
*ALARM*
Mor... *cough* Mor... *choke*
More? As long as you're sure, Captain. After we deal with these Morganas, what say we go another ten miles?
@BATTLE
Ursula? What's all this? A podium and a gavel? Are you sentencing the crew to latrine duty for not raising enough money?
Not quite, Captain. This is the second part of my fundraising campaign. A service auction!
Service auction?
Exactly. The crew will bid and the winner will win my servitude for 24 hours. I'll do anything you ask of me.
Anything?
Anything.
Interesting. It looks like the crew has turned out in full force for this event.
Well, of course. As much as you might dislike some of my fundraising ideas, I think even you have to admit that you're wrong on this occasion.
Okay, okay, I can see--
You see, for someone as pure-hearted as me, this kind of thing comes naturally. All these years at sea seem to have dampened your soul, Captain.
Uh-huh...
Oh! We're about to begin. Of course, Captain, you are free to bid as well.

Fields.MenuText: Am I now? Well then... I'd better take my seat...

Fields.DialogueText: Hello everyone, thank you for coming! As I've already explained the format for today's auction, let's just get straight down to business!
*ALARM*
Quickly, men! We'll deal with these Morganas then return post-haste!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: This wouldn't be a conflict of interests?

Fields.DialogueText: Only if our interests conflict, and I don't think there's any danger of that. Now, shall we?

Fields.MenuText: You're sure the crew won't abuse your charity?

Fields.DialogueText: I haven't the slightest idea what you might mean. Let's get right down to it, then.
I've got £1 over here, £1, £1 from the gentleman in the back, do I hear £1 2s from anyone, £1 2s from anyone at all?
One pound, two shillings! More than I got paid in a week in my first job!
Very generous, sir! I hear £1 2s, I hear £1 2s over here, can I get a £1 4s from anyone in the back, £1 4s--
Two pounds!
£2, that's an honest week's pay now! £2 is the current bid, £2 going once, going twice, and--
£2-- £20?! Who is that?
Sorry, men, but I couldn't pass up the opportunity. You were right, Ursula. This is by far the best idea you've ever had. I will humbly admit my mistake.
Oh, please no...
Perhaps we could discuss your genius more while you rub my back and feed me locust berries.
Anyone!? Does anyone have a bid more than £20!? Please!

Fields.MenuText: Ha! These men lost all of their money to the charity funrun.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course... How could I forget?

Fields.MenuText: Would you rather start with a back or foot massage, Ursula?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't imagine doing either!

Fields.MenuText: No one's raising their hand.

Fields.DialogueText: Give them time, Captain! It's rude to rush people.
Going once... Going twice... Going twice and a half...
*BANG*
Sold to the Captain...
Don't look so glum, Ursula. We're in for one hell of an afternoon!
Captain... when I said I would do anything... I never imagined you would make me do something like this...
Are you a woman of your word or not?
I am but... it's so embarrassing...

Fields.MenuText: I'll have none of your complaining. Now, hurry up and get to work!
You asked for this, you know. Now get to it!
I haven't got all day! Chop, chop!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, Captain...
Good, good.
Does this feel good, Captain?
Yes, that's the stuff. I'm surprised considering this is your first time. This is your first time, isn't it?
Of course! I could never bring myself to do something like this... If it's for you though, Captain, I suppose it's okay. I am getting paid after all...
Make sure you hit every spot. Don't leave a single area untouched.
Yes, Captain. Although, my hands are starting to cramp a little.
Is that so? Well, I'm no slave driver. Come, take a break from massaging my feet and feed me some locust berries instead.
How degrading...
This is the life, huh, Ursula?
I'm positively living the dream, Captain. Say "ahh."
Any other ideas for how to raise money for your charity?
I have a few ideas. Perhaps we could discuss them sometime soon. Under the proviso that you don't choke to death on these berries, of course...
What was that?
*ALARM*
Nothing, Captain! You must have misheard me under the blare from the Morgana alarm. Shall we reconvene later and discuss my next venture?
Sure thing. Let's get to work!
@BATTLE
What are you writing there, Ursula? Planning your next fundraising event?
Not quite, Captain. I'm struggling to think of new and exciting ideas to encourage people to send money, so I decided to write to my sisters and ask for their advice.
Your sisters? I thought you guys weren't that close?
Through no fault of my own, Captain. I've tried to maintain at least a cordial relationship with them, but I'll always just be the inferior little sister to them...
What have you written so far?
*Ahem* "Dearest sisters. Hope all is well. To mend this world rife with pestilence and depravity, I have shouldered the responsibility of innovating and expostulating to my crew a--"
I think I see the problem. Ursula, did you just read that thesaurus or did you eat it for breakfast!?
What do you mean?
I mean, even I am finding it difficult to take you seriously when you speak like that.
Did you have any suggestions?

Fields.MenuText: Tone down the synonyms a little.

Fields.DialogueText: You may be right. I have gone through several pages already rewriting draft versions of the letter. "Expostulate" takes up nearly an entire line all by itself!

Fields.MenuText: Just express how you're feeling.

Fields.DialogueText: I think I understand what you mean, Captain. More than "Hungry!" but less than "Signing off from your scintillating and subservient sister."

Fields.MenuText: Talk to them how you'd talk to me.

Fields.DialogueText: You both do command a great deal of respect. If I can talk to you freely, then I should have no qualms talking with my sisters the same way.
*ALARM*
I'll handle these Morganas and then get right back to work. Thank you for your advice, Captain!
@BATTLE
Captain, I finished my letter. I was wondering if you could read through it to check if it sounds natural.
I'd be happy to. Why don't you read it to me?
Out loud!?
What better way to check if it sounds like everyday speech than to have you speak it!
Very well...
*ALARM*
Hold that thought. Morganas inbound! Let's teach them a lesson, Ursula!
@BATTLE
Okay, I'm all ears!
"To Undine and Unity,"
"It feels like forever since we last spoke. I hold my hands up in part for not reaching out sooner. I understand you both must be very busy and I apologise for any intrusion this letter causes."

"I hope you are both doing well and wanted to inform you that I am happy and healthy. I appreciate all the support you have given me thus far and will do you proud as best I can.

Love, Ursie."

Fields.MenuText: That was great!
How long did it take you to write?

Fields.DialogueText: You really mean that, Captain?
Longer than I'd like to admit, to be quite honest.

Fields.MenuText: Are Undine and Unity really so above you?

Fields.DialogueText: They carry with them the "Undine-class" legacy. Should they pass, I will be left to pick up the mantle. I cannot sully such a name due to my incompetence.
Still, if I had to nitpick something...
You didn't like it after all!?
No, I loved it! But...
But?
You didn't mention anything about the fundraiser!
... I see. It looks like I got a little carried away. Perhaps my emotional threshold is like a dam in that it is only possible of either restraining feeling entirely or letting everything burst out.
Well, in my opinion, I'd take a burst dam over an ice princess every day of the week.
Thank you for that touching yet metaphorically strange sentiment, Captain. I'll try and be more honest with my feelings from now onwards.
So Ursula, did your sisters come back with any good ideas?
Yes, Captain. One great idea they had was to host a talent show.
I see. How would that work with regard to the funding?
Unity suggested that participants can pay to enter and whoever wins chooses the charity they wish to donate to.
That's a great idea! Although... I must admit, I'm not certain as to the level of talent aboard this ship.
You couldn't be more wrong, Captain! I've been asking around and it seems people are extremely enthused about the whole idea.

Fields.MenuText: I dread to think what some of these men consider to be a talent...

Fields.DialogueText: I've made those concerns clear, Captain. We don't have to worry about any belching of the alphabet.

Fields.MenuText: Did your sisters reply to your personal message as well?

Fields.DialogueText: I believe they said something like "Happy you're still alive." It's probably the kindest thing they've ever said to me.

Fields.MenuText: I haven't been in a talent show since my primary school days.

Fields.DialogueText: Let me guess… stand-up comedy? Those knock knock jokes from before were particularly amusing.
Of course, I will be participating as well.
What's your talent?
That's a secret, Captain. Although, don't hesitate to enter the show yourself on my account. I'd like to see what you have to offer.
Okay then, maybe I will.
*ALARM*
*THUD*
Oh, sorry about that Ursula. The alarm surprised me, I didn't mean to bump into you.
It's okay, Captain. No harm done.
I don't suppose killing Morganas counts as a talent.
If it did you'd still place second behind me, Captain. Let me show you why.
Don't count me out too quickly! I'm a jack of all trades with a heart to match!
@BATTLE
Aaaaaand Zebra!
*CLAPPING*
Thank you very much, Mike, for that… riveting presentation of one animal for each letter in the alphabet. I'm not sure how "Xtra large duck" fits, but it's better than having you do it again.
Next up is… Captain?
Yes, I'm ready.
Do you need me to do--
No, no, just let me have the floor.
Okay, well then everyone… without further ado… the Captain.
*CHEERING*
I'm going to do a magic act. Firstly, I'll need a volunteer.
Hmm… Who should I pick…?
Ursula! How about you?
You kept me in suspense for a tad too long there, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Please introduce yourself to the crowd.
Where are you coming from today?
Is this your first time at a magic show?

Fields.DialogueText: My name is Ursula. I'm a well-renowned sceptic. I love animals. Um... yeah.
Originally, I'm from Cornwall but I've picked up a Welsh accent from my travels.
Thankfully, yes.
*ALARM*
Sorry everyone, we'll continue after taking out these Morganas!
@BATTLE
See this deck of playing cards here? Pick a card, any card. Feel free to choose whatever suit or number you like.
Okay.
Look at it. Memorise it. But don't show me.
Done.
Put it back into the deck and I'll shuffle them up.
I'm on the edge of my seat, Captain…
Now, behold! Your card was the…

Fields.MenuText: Ace of Spades
Two of Clubs
Ten of Diamonds

Fields.DialogueText: Not even close, unfortunately.
Really? Well, maybe if you check your pocket.
Captain, this is getting a little embarrassing, if I'm being…
Oh? Something the matter?
What is… the Jack of Hearts… but how did you...!? When did you!?
*WHOOPING*
Thank you! Thank you! I'll be here all war!
*ALARM*
While Ursula collects herself, we'll be taking a brief intermission. The talent show will be back after a brief message from our diabolical enemy.
@BATTLE
Captain, while we set up for my final performance, you have to tell me; how did you do that?
I didn't realize you were such a killjoy. Don't you know; a magician never reveals their...
*GLAAAAAAAAAARE*
Very well.
*ALARM*
Hold that thought, Captain. I want zero distractions while you explain yourself to me.
@BATTLE
Do you remember the brief interaction we had before the talent show started?
Vaguely.
("Oh, sorry about that Ursula. The alarm surprised me, I didn't mean to bump into you.")
("It's okay, Captain, no harm done.")
You planted the card on me all the way back then?
Yup.
But how did you know I would pick the Jack of Hearts during the show?
All it took was a little suggestive speech.
("Don't count me out too quickly! I'm a jack of all trades with a heart to match!")
I can't believe I'm so easily susceptible to such tactics...

Fields.MenuText: Don't get down on yourself.
It was only supposed to be fun.
Isn't being deceived part of the thrill?

Fields.DialogueText: It's hard to feel too good about myself when all it takes to influence me is a single line...
I know. I'm having a blast...
Normally, yes. However, when I think of the implications this could have on the war, I worry about my mental fortitude.
Ursula, you don't have to link everything back to the war. I know you're worried about letting Undine and Unity down.
Why in the world would letting something down ever be a good idea? Tell me, Captain, what is it so good to let down!?
Your hair.
... Captain... I...
*WOOO*
There's no time! Ursula, you're up! Let them have it!
Yes... could you hold this?
Sure, what is it?
It's my hair band. Thank you, Captain.
But sometimes letting things down is important. I think you may have forgotten that.
Thank you everyone for joining us for this impromptu talent show!
*CLAPPING*
Everyone did such a great job and I'm proud to announce that we have raised, collectively, over £1000 for charity!
*CHEERING*
So, for the finale, I thought I would perform a brief solo of the United Kingdom's national anthem.
I hope that, through my voice, you remember what this money will be used for and what we're fighting for. Thank you.
*ONE EMOTIONAL SOLO LATER*
Are you people deaf?! Clap for the girl!
*CHEERING*
That was amazing, Ursula!
We were too moved to speak!
We're honored to fight alongside you!
Th...Thank you, everyone. I... I have to go!
Ursula, wait!
*ALARM*
Men! Handle these Morganas! I'll go and find Ursula!
@BATTLE
Ursula!? Are you down here!?
Over here, Captain...
Ursula, what's going on? You just ran off when the crew were cheering for you.
I don't understand it myself. I felt a swelling in my chest, my eyes became watery, and I felt like my throat was in a knot.

Fields.MenuText: You've never had your chest swell before?
You've never had your eyes water before?
You've never had your throat in a knot before?

Fields.DialogueText: I remember, when I received the letter from my sisters, I felt a similar feeling.
I haven't cried since I was a child.
I'm allergic to peanuts, but nothing like this.
Sounds to me like you were so moved by the crew's words that you got a little choked up.
I think so too, but... I'm not ready to show that side of me to them yet. They still think of me as a little sister and I'd like to not fall back into such a role.
That's okay, Ursula. You put on a brave face for the crew and, whenever you feel like crying, you come to my quarters and we can cry together.
Yes, Captain!
*ALARM*
What do you say we give these Morganas something to cry about?
I'm right behind you!
@BATTLE
Hello again, everyone. I just wanted to apologise for my sudden outburst. When nature calls, it's hard to ignore.
*Wink*
*Wink*
Nevertheless, I've tallied your votes and we have a clear winner!
So, the winner by a single vote is...
The Captain!
*WOOOP*
Come on up here, Captain!
I don't know what to say.
The academy?
The Magic Academy. It was a kids' show I used to watch. That's where I learnt all my tricks!
Okay, Captain, so where would you like to send this £1000?
I'd like to send it to Save the Children. Orphaned children struggle for so much in this life and it's important we protect them. Isn't that right, Ursula?
Y... yes... it is...
Let's everyone give one more round of applause to Ursula for organizing this great event!
*CHEERING*

Fields.MenuText: I'd like to thank the academy!
I'd like to thank my mother for always supporting me!
I'd like to thank the crew for always putting up with my orders!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure she's very proud of you, Captain. It's every mother's dream for their child to grow up to become a... funny magician.
We know you always have our best interests at heart, Captain.
*ALARM*
Everyone, for one last time today, please lend me your support!
@BATTLE
What a great show! I can't believe I won! And by one vote, no less.
Yes, well, as much as I would have liked to have voted for myself, I couldn't help but cast my vote for you. You really made my day.
That magic show was pretty stunning, huh? Wha--!? What's with the hug, Ursula?
I wasn't talking about the magic show, Captain. Must you always be so dense?
Captain, Captain!
I'm here, Ursula! What's with you?
*Pant* *pant* During our last docking, I took all the proceeds we had made to the nearest charity organization.
Yes?
They were so overwhelmed! They told me it was the largest donation they had ever received!
That's great, Ursula! I'm so proud of you!
That isn't the best part, Captain. They asked me, seeing as I had such a passion for volunteer work, if I would be willing to conduct a televised broadcast urging people to donate!

Fields.MenuText: How long should the presentation be?

Fields.DialogueText: No longer than five minutes. It will air one time only during a brief break in the programming schedule.

Fields.MenuText: How much money did you raise?

Fields.DialogueText: I couldn't believe it myself at first, but I managed to hit my dream goal of £5000!

Fields.MenuText: Can I have your autograph now or later?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not going to become a superstar. I'll barely be on the screen for ten minutes!
Just to think... Ursula on the big screen... broadcasting to tens of thousands of people across the country... on the most popular broadcasting service in the whole of the UK - the BBC.
Tens... of thousands...?
Everyone staring directly at you, listening intently to every single word that leaves your mouth.
I'm sure... some people will have better things to do than watch me...
Not if I have anything to do with it! I'll make some calls and ensure everyone in the country is watching you!
*ALARM*
Is that alarm real or is it just in my head...?
Morganas! Let's deal with them quickly!
Yes... Captain. Then I think I might have to lie down for a while...
@BATTLE
Hard at work writing your presentation, I see.
Actually, Captain, I have to admit I'm feeling a tad nervous.
You have nothing to worry about. You talk to me about charity so passionately! Anyone who heard one of those lectures would whip out their wallet immediately.
I spoke with the organization and told them that, because of my duties at sea, I wouldn't be able to return for some time. However, they said that whenever I'm ready, they will be waiting.
That's good news. So, let me have a peek at what you've written?
Definitely not, Captain! It's far from presentable!

Fields.MenuText: Are you having issues writing it?

Fields.DialogueText: Kind of. It's hard to strike a comfortable balance between overly preachy and strictly disciplined.

Fields.MenuText: Have you ever done this kind of thing before?

Fields.DialogueText: I said a few words at Undine and Unity's christening, but that's about it.

Fields.MenuText: How far have you gotten?

Fields.DialogueText: "Thank you very much for that warm introduction..."
It sounds like you have it rough. Perhaps I could lend a hand.
Really?
I've given a speech or two in my time. Speeches that have driven the most cowardly soldier to their feet.
That's amazing, Captain. Your input would be much appreciated!
It's settled, then. Stop by my office and we'll get to work.
*ALARM*
Right after dispatching these Morganas!
@BATTLE
How about you start by explaining to me exactly what you want to say during your broadcast?
As you already know, Captain, I have limited time available to plead my case.
I understand.
All I hope to do is inform people about the dangers young orphans face, especially during wartime. I'd like them to open their wallets out of genuine concern instead of feeling obligated.
That sounds like a great message. I'm sure you'll be able to write something profound.
Thank you, Captain.
The only problem is...
... I'm sorry to drop such a huge revelation on you, Captain... But I have been known to suffer from a little stage fright now and again...

Fields.MenuText: What? You? I would have never guessed...
How long have you been afraid of public speaking?
Have you tried picturing the audience naked?

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know, it must be hard to take in. Still, as much as you may believe it to be so, even I am not a perfect being.
Undine and Unity were always in the spotlight. From a young age I watched them and it always looked so daunting.
Perhaps that trick works on a small audience. It would be difficult for me to imagine the naked bodies of 55,000 people.
I have a few tricks we can work on to cure your stage-fright.
*ALARM*
After we take out these Morganas, of course.
@BATTLE
*RUFF*
I'm not sure what exactly the point of this exercise is, Captain.
We need to get down to the root of your stage fright.
If I had to hazard a guess, it would be that I worry people won't take me seriously. They'll think of me as a child.
Exactly! So what we need to do is tap into your inner ice princess and get mean!
Mean?

Fields.MenuText: Less mean and more strict.

Fields.DialogueText: So, why is Churchill here?
He's going to be the test dummy. I want you to slander his name WITHOUT reneging on any remarks you make.

Fields.MenuText: Have you ever gotten mean before?

Fields.DialogueText: If Undine ate the last of the pudding, I wouldn't be too enthused about it.

Fields.MenuText: If I had to liken it to something, it would be the face you put on when facing Morganas. Your "war face," if you will.

Fields.DialogueText: Interesting.
Ok, now… let him have it!
*ALARM*
I have a few choice words for these Morganas as well, Captain. Perhaps they would satisfy as a warm-up.
I don't see why not!
@BATTLE
*BARK*
Churchill… I don't appreciate you chewing the post of my bed frame. It was very difficult to repair.
*bark…*
Fight it!
Resist!
I can't do it, Captain! Look at his face; he knows what he did was wrong! You won't do it again right, Churchill?
*RUFF!* (I most certainly will do it again without a second thought.)
See! He's a good boy! Yes, you are! Yes, you are!

Fields.MenuText: This is hopeless…
Ursula…
You couldn't even go one round…

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sorry! I can't help it!
Looks like we're going to have to try something else. Come along now, no time to waste.
*ALARM*
I'm sure we can spare a moment to pay these Morganas a visit!
@BATTLE
Oh, Churchill. I just can't seem to get over this stage fright.
*WAN* (It's okay, Ursula. Things like this take time. You don't have to force yourself).
I know, but I feel like I'm letting the Captain down with each and every failed attempt.
*BARK* (To be honest, I think it's a little preposterous that someone of your standing is scared of speaking publicly. If I were you, I would be too ashamed to continue living.)
That's very insightful, Churchill. Thank you for the kind barks.
*Ruff...* (Honestly...)
Ursula! Sorry I'm late!
No harm done, Captain. I was just catching up with the goings-on in Churchill's day-to-day.
*BARK* (Please take me away from this ghastly wench before I claw my own eyes out from frustration. Hmph!)

Fields.MenuText: I love you too, buddy.
Sorry, but I have to steal your mommy away for a little while.
Mind if I cut in on your lady friend here?

Fields.DialogueText: Run along now, Churchill, we have people things to discuss. You wouldn't understand.
*BARK*
So, Ursula. I was thinking we could try one final tactic. Let's have you try and present your finished speech in front of the crew.
If you think it will help... I suppose I can give it a try.
Great! You finish things up and I'll organize the rest.
*ALARM*
Speaking of finishing things... let's finish off these Morganas.
@BATTLE
Ursula! I've told everyone about your presentation, so all that's left is for you to finish your speech.
Actually, Captain, I was just putting the finishing touches on it now.
Wonderful! I'll tell the rest of the crew to--
Actually, I was hoping I could present it to you first. Alone.

Fields.MenuText: Are you still scared?
Do you want my advice?

Fields.DialogueText: Not particularly, but...
I suppose you could say that.

Fields.MenuText: I feel like a VIP.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... to me you are...
I'd be happy to listen to it! Stop by my quarters and I'll make sure to give you my honest opinion.
Yes, Captain.
*ALARM*
Morganas, inbound! Let's take them out, Ursula!
@BATTLE
I'm ready whenever you are, Ursula.
Thank you again, Captain. For everything.
"Hello. I'm coming to you live today with a message we can all strive to remember. In a world rife with war, we can sometimes forget what exactly we're fighting for."
"We all desire the same outcome - a free world in which the next generation can frolic without worry."
"However, by losing ourselves in battle, it is not only our brethren that suffer, but our children as well."
"I come to you today not to beg for your hard-earned paycheck, but to hopefully inspire the courage inside each and every one of you to rise to the surface."
"Should you find yourself with a pocket full of loose change and nothing to spend it on, consider donating to Save the Children. They will be eternally grateful. Thank you."
And we're clear...
Phew! How was that, Captain?

Fields.MenuText: My chest is starting to swell.
My eyes are growing watery.
My throat is in knots.

Fields.DialogueText: You aren't just humoring me, Captain?
Never! I loved it!
*ALARM*
Ursula, let's quickly deal with these Morganas.
Yes, Captain!
@BATTLE
So, do you think you're ready to present it to the crew?
I suppose, with your support, I can do it. I'll try my best.
"Thank you."
*CHEERING*
Thank you very much, everyone! I hope I can do you proud during my broadcast.
*CROWD DISPERSING*
That was great, Ursula! Not a single flubbed word or forgotten line.
Ah, Captain. It's all thanks to your teachings. I could never have done this without you.

Fields.MenuText: Do you feel ready for the BBC?
Do you think your speech can really make a difference?
Next stop, the West End?

Fields.DialogueText: More than ready, Captain!
That isn't my goal, Captain. I will do all I can in my free time to aid in charitable efforts. My mission here is only to inform. The rest is up to the general public.
I'm not sure about that, Captain. Maybe if I came across my childhood tap shoes.
Ursula?
Yes, Captain.
I'd like you to come to my quarters whenever you have time. I have something I need to tell you.
I'm in suspense, Captain. Can't you tell me now?
*ALARM*
Saved by the bell. After we take out these Morganas, I'll tell you everything.
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
Captain? Are you in here?
Ursula. Please take a seat.
Am I in trouble?
Ha! As much as you claim to be mature, you don't do yourself any favors.
Hmph! Why exactly did you drag me down here?
I wanted to tell you something that I couldn't bring myself to say in front of the crew.
Stage fright, Captain. After everything you taught me? If this is about Churchill relieving himself on your newspaper again, I told you I'm--
I wanted to tell you… how proud of you I am.
… Captain?

Fields.MenuText: You have grown so much recently.

Fields.DialogueText: I assume you're talking metaphorically. I haven't grown an inch in years...

Fields.MenuText: You have done such good for the world.

Fields.DialogueText: I've barely even scratched the surface...

Fields.MenuText: You have inspired so much inside me.

Fields.DialogueText: I didn't enlighten you about anything you didn't already know…
I'll admit, I judged you on first impressions. I assumed you were a cold ice princess lacking in emotion and social etiquette.
I hope a "but" is coming soon, Captain.
But I couldn't have been more wrong.
Captain, what are you trying to say?
*ALARM*
I'll finish my point after finishing these Morganas!
@BATTLE
Captain? You were making a point.
Yes. All I wanted to ask was… are we friends?
What an odd question to ask! What kind of incredibly moronic and braindead--
Ursula…
*Sigh* I know I can be difficult to read sometimes. I hide behind a veil of ice to protect myself from getting hurt.
Captain, I consider you the closest friend I have ever met. I am proud to stand alongside you.
One last thing. Can I call you... Ursie?
Only my sisters call me Ursie but... I suppose, just this once, I can make an exception.
